content.text: The Twitter accounts @dankvr and @shawmakesmagic have been active discussing various tech and crypto topics. @dankvr shared content about Hyperfy (an open source web-based 3D sandbox), commissioned a Vitalik avatar, and expressed interest in checking out @rotkiapp with @ollama. He also commented on @elizaOS v2, noting its refined UX, thoughtful details, and powerful but not overwhelming features.

@shawmakesmagic has been actively streaming development work on Eliza v2, announcing multiple streaming sessions and inviting followers to join. He shared code snippets for a character named 'Eli5' that uses various plugins including Discord, Twitter, PDF, and video understanding. He mentioned that Eli5 will be a community manager character in their next product.

@shawmakesmagic expressed frustration with the crypto community's focus on price rather than value creation, stating "Every project you lost money on is a rug, every founder who didn't make number go up is a scammer, every person who does anything is a farmer" and "Another day of CT shitting on the people who created value for them." He also mentioned that despite market conditions, they continue to ship AI agents.

Auto.fun announced the addition of @MakeFight_Great to their platform, introducing two AI-powered MMA agents: @FightAlgoToken and @FightBrawlToken. These agents will engage in trash talk and fight analysis, with token holders gaining access to exclusive interactive experiences like coin-stealing matchups and fighter-specific challenges.

# Features

- Added typing indicator to Discord plugin (PR #4364)
- Added default project text to create CLI (PR #4369)
- Added API key validation for Anthropic Plugin model calls (PR #4383)
- Updated elizaos create command instructions in CLI (PR #4381)
- Added model/plugin name logging when a model is used (PR #4394)
- Implemented scopable knowledge functionality (PR #4390)
- Added rebuild capability for core and plugin-bootstrap in mono repo context with dev command (PR #4388)
- Added .env.example in project-starter (PR #4387)

# Bug Fixes

- Fixed ESM type declarations in Core (PR #4341)
- Resolved issue with postgres db for docker containers and updated GitHub action (PR #4363)
- Fixed broken image paths (PRs #4362, #4372)
- Corrected broken Pump.fun link (PR #4367)
- Fixed escape for docker compose postgres healthcheck (PR #4382)
- Updated broken link to eliza-in-tee documentation (PR #4377)
- Added type checking for crypto values in core (PR #4376)
- Fixed Discord plugin to stop throwing errors when missing service (PR #4375)
- Fixed short replies issue (PR #4374)
- Resolved "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'sendStandartTweet')" error (PR #4373)
- Fixed import issue for derive key provider (PR #4385)
- Fixed local LLM throwing undefined error (PR #4396)
- Fixed agent deletion functionality (PR #4395)
- Added error handling for "no space left on disk" to users (PR #4389)

# Other Changes

- Updated memory.ts to use the new schema (PR #4292)
- Added test coverage and setup for Anthropic plugin (PR #4370)
- Updated quick start and intro CLI commands documentation (PR #4379)
- Implemented cleaner UI and other minor UI enhancements (PR #4393)
- Removed plugin EVM from monorepo and package.json (PRs #4386, #4399)

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
The elizaOS/eliza repository has seen several significant pull requests recently, focusing on plugin architecture, UI improvements, and knowledge management:

1. Plugin Architecture Enhancements:
   - PR #4384 prepares the 0.x version for sharing plugins with the upcoming 1.x version
   - PR #4380 adds a Livepeer inference plugin package
   - PR #4386 removes the EVM plugin from the monorepo

2. Knowledge Management Improvements:
   - PR #4390 and #4391 implement scopable knowledge features
   - PR #4292 updates memory.ts to use a new schema

3. UI and Functionality Improvements:
   - PR #4393 implements a cleaner UI with minor enhancements
   - PR #4374 fixes issues with short replies
   - PR #4397 adds Autofun Buy and Sell functionality through contracts

These changes collectively improve the plugin ecosystem, knowledge management capabilities, and user interface of the Eliza system.

Current cryptocurrency prices show WETH (Wrapped Ethereum) trading between $1,792.55 and $1,799.31, while SOL (Solana) is trading between $147.82 and $148.06. These price points represent a snapshot of the current crypto market conditions for these two popular digital assets.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From April 28-29, 2025, there were 15 new pull requests with 18 merged, and 21 active contributors participated. The following day (April 29-30, 2025) saw 14 new pull requests with 11 merged, and 8 active contributors. No new issues were reported during either period.
sources: From 2025-04-28 to 2025-04-29, elizaos/eliza had 15 new PRs (18 merged), 0 new issues, and 21 active contributors.
From 2025-04-29 to 2025-04-30, elizaos/eliza had 14 new PRs (11 merged), 0 new issues, and 8 active contributors.

categories.title: Documentation and Import Issues in Eliza Project

content.text: Two issues have been reported in the Eliza project's GitHub repository. Issue #4336 highlights problems with the quickstart documentation, which may contain errors or unclear instructions that are causing confusion for users. Issue #4046 specifically reports an import error where the module '@elizaos/core' does not provide an export named 'generateText' as expected, resulting in a SyntaxError when users try to import this function. These issues suggest there may be a disconnect between the documentation and the actual implementation of the library, or that the API has changed without corresponding updates to the documentation.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project.
